ref: 2281 úpaharati ʻ brings near, offers (food) ʼ AV., ʻ takes away ʼ MBh., ˚tē ʻ accepts ʼ TS. [√hr̥]
Pk. uvaharaï ʻ presents, offers in worship ʼ;
Dm. wâr -- , wōar -- ʻ to catch ʼ NTS xii 194; --

L. vāraṇ ʻ to devote, sacrifice ʼ as well phon. and semant. < upā́harati ʻ brings near, offers ʼ ŚBr., or upā́carati ʻ approaches, attends on, serves ʼ or upā́karōti ʻ fetches, makes preparation for a sacrifice ʼ T
Pk. uvāiṇaï ʻ makes a mental vow to do some special service for a deity on completion of some work ʼ < *upākr̥ṇōti).
